summary: This bill, the Greater Yellowstone Recreation Enhancement And Tourism Act, aims to designate specific segments of the Gallatin, Madison, and Yellowstone Rivers and their tributaries in Montana as components of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. This action is intended to protect the ecological integrity and recreational values of these rivers for future generations. The bill also specifies conditions regarding water rights, existing infrastructure, and hydropower operations in the area, ensuring compatibility with current development and use.
